Each sample requires at least   working on the assumption that   of fresh tissue is disrupted. It is advisable to prepare   of RLT per sample, to ensure sufficient buffer is made. (So for 10 samples, this would be  )","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":128,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":161,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":220,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":312,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ijjl","text":"To prepare RLT buffer, in a fresh tube add   β-ME per   Buffer RLT.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ikk","text":"Add 4 volumes of ethanol (96–100%) to Buffer RPE for a working solution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lomt","text":"Prepare DNase I stock solution before using the RNase-Free DNase Set for the first time. Dissolve the lyophilized DNase I (1500 Kunitz units) in 550 µl of the RNase-free water provided. To avoid loss of DNase I, do not open the vial. Inject RNase-free water into the vial using an RNase-free needle and syringe. Mix gently by inverting the vial. Do not vortex (DNase I is especially sensitive to physical denaturation. Mixing should only be carried out by gently inverting the tube.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fogjd","text":" For long-term storage of DNase I, remove the stock solution from the glass vial, divide it into single-use aliquots, and store at –20°C for up to 9 months. Thawed aliquots can be stored at 2–8°C for up to 6 weeks. Do not refreeze the aliquots after thawing.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9id37","text":"Calculate the volume of DNase I working solution required for the number of samples to be processed. Each sample requires  . Make a master mix containing   of DNAse I per sample and  buffer RDD. It is advisable to make up 10-20% extra than you need to account for pipetting inaccuracies. (So for 10 samples this would be  of DNAse I and   of buffer RDD). Prepare in a new nuclease-free tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":122,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":154,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":181,"length":1},{"key":9,"offset":321,"length":1},{"key":10,"offset":337,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9sv8u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64bbb","text":"Collect samples immediately into liquid nitrogen and store at -80C.  Grind per \"Grinding Tissue with the Qiagen Tissuelyzer\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":125}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"450","guid":"32A3A2903AF711EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","guid":"38B410703AF711EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":5}},"10":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"840","guid":"5F5325303B0211EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","guid":"309A3E003AF711EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","guid":"2DB805A03AF711EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"7FC784C03AF611EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"86A7ECD03AF611EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":2}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"80","guid":"F9959CF03B0111EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"7":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"1F604BB03B0211EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"8":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"70","guid":"2157D5F03B0211EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"9":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"120","guid":"5CE692003B0211EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cq14g","text":"This is a protocol for extraction of RNA from plant leaf tissue using a QIAGEN RNeasy Plant Mini Kit. The procedure largely follows the manufacturer's instructions but there are a few minor tweaks we introduced which in our hands were necessary for optimal results. This protocol also includes the on-column DNase I digestion step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5vi7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"446a6","text":"The original protocol is attached fork_info.title: QIAGEN RNeasy Plant RNA Extraction Protocol (Modified)

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"atk51","text":"It is critical that you do not overload the spin columns to ensure high purity of final RNA. Therefore before sampling determine how much an individual leaf disk weighs then harvest and freeze only 100 mg or less of fresh leaf tissue per sample vial. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"drcdt","text":"TissueLyser II (QIAGEN; 85300)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":13}],"data":[]},{"key":"7ujfu","text":"2 mL centrifuge tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2jaib","text":"4mm SPEXTM stainless steel grinding beads (SPEX; 2150)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":43,"length":10}],"data":[]},{"key":"b8lcd","text":"Humboldt brass cork borer set (07-865-10B; Fisher Scientific)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aaaq2","text":"13.4 mm diameter, flash-frozen leaf disks","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ev9d","text":"RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (QIAGEN; 74904)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dl8mr","text":"RNase-Free DNase Set (QIAGEN; 79254)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"36C427E23B0711EB852C0A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/human-id-and-forensics/automation/tissuelyser-ii/#orderinginformation"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"36C428523B0711EB852C0A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.fishersci.co.uk/shop/products/spex-sampleprep-stainless-steel-grinding-balls-4mm-diameter/12145950"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tvhq","text":"Add   Buffer RLT to a maximum of 100 mg tissue powder. Vortex immediately until the powder is re-suspended.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f7dt0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8fh2d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"d7dko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"450","guid":"A5E69FA03AF711EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":"79296","label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":272}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"30lta","text":"This step can take up to a couple of minutes. If lumps form it can lead to partial thawing before the powder is completely dissolved in the buffer and degradation of RNA due to the activity of endogenous RNAses. It is therefore advisable to start with samples that are at   , (tubes on dry ice) rather than moving samples straight from LN2, which has a greater tendency for lumps to form. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a40bl","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":161,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"s203","text":"It is critical to pre-weigh your samples so as not to overload the spin columns, using too much tissue will result in sub-standard purity of RNA after extraction","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d1bk0","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"F1516AB03AF711EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"-70","unit":10},"mutability":"","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9be8b","text":"Spin samples   to pellet any residual debris.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8ed6l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6qd7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fktfi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"guid":"2B4A40503AFF11EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4cc1d","text":"This is not included in the original protocol, ideally following proper grinding and re-suspension there should be little to no debris or clumps. However, in our experience, there can be aggregates of insoluble material, spinning will help keep these to the bottom of the centrifuge tube","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3e95p","text":"Transfer the lysate to a QIAshredder spin column (lilac) placed in a   collection tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"btql0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bjsgm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dtp3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"2","guid":"054430303C0511EB869E89B6DE7B6DA1","id":"79297","label":"","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4oamv","text":"Be careful not to disturb any pellet, if you are having trouble with the tip getting blocked it can help to cut off the end","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jdes","text":"Transfer the supernatant of the flow-through to a new microcentrifuge tube (not supplied) without disturbing the cell-debris pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3u36h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9cehh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7cbt0","text":"Use nuclease-free centrifuge tubes","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3gi7m","text":"Add 0.5 volume of ethanol (96–100%) to the cleared lysate, and mix immediately by pipetting. DNase digestion will be incomplete if part of the mix sticks to the walls or the O-ring of the spin column","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Otherwise, samples will likely be contaminated with residual guanidium salts and leaf pigments.   ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vror","text":"Transfer the column to a new 2 mL collection tube. Add   Buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid, and spin for  . Discard flow-through after inspecting the color.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":123,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ae68l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"b6kc7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3mr3e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","guid":"27AE89B03B0411EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":"79304","label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":15,"guid":"33360BA03B0411EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"227j","text":"* This differs from the original protocol *","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"33m4q","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4m7p0","text":"Samples are transferred to a new collection tube in this instance to allow you to see if the flow-through is colorless. If it is not, repeat the RPE washes until no coloration can be seen in the sample. Realistically this shouldn't be more than one additional spin, if your flow-through is still very green you probably have too much sample in the first place and should consider starting again.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d18p","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1efhv","text":"Transfer the spin column to a fresh tube, spin for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"a7ca1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9q68p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dirog","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":120,"guid":"E8C2CA803B0411EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3qi77","text":"This is to ensure removal of residual EtOH on the column, it is important to ensure high purity RNA samples for downstream analysis","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f08ti","text":"Place the RNeasy spin column in a new nuclease-free   collection tube (supplied). Add   RNase-free water directly to the spin column membrane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1.5","guid":"190168503B0511EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":"79305","label":"","unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"50","guid":"26229D103B0511EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":"79306","label":"","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63e5q","text":"Close the lid, and spin for   to elute the RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7j2u8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"12000","duration":60,"guid":"386301E03B0511EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1i3s5","text":"Place samples on ice or store at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1fg6m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"arufl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9sjft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"51D8CC903B0511EB96C78DDD3D7D6B52","id":"44143","label":"","temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"38sa1","text":"For best results, it is advisable to proceed directly to downstream applications.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bn3r2","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2rfr7","text":"e.g. check RNA amount and purity using a Nanodrop. A260/A280 ratio should be \u003e2 and A260/A230 ratio should be \u003e1.8.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"euut0","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bog27","text":"Check RNA integrity using Qubit Fluorometer and perform cDNA synthesis","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
